importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date, marking the start of the investigation into her disappearance and the subsequent discovery of her remains.
The remains of Kada Scott were found on this date, leading to confirmation of her identity and the formal charges against Keon King.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen and seen near where Scott was found, indicating a timeline directly tied to her disappearance.
The car was seen on video near the recreation center on Oct. 4, and reported on fire three days later, placing it within a key investigative window.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman, was found dead in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia after being missing for about two weeks.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide.
DNA testing confirmed the remains belonged to Kada Scott, following an anonymous tip that led investigators to return to the site where they previously searched.
King’s cellphone was found in locations related to Scott’s disappearance, and there is extensive video evidence linking him to her case.
A stolen Hyundai Accent was seen parked near the recreation center on Oct. 4, the day Scott went missing, and was later found on fire, with the vehicle later compacted at a junkyard.
Additional charges are under consideration, and authorities believe others may have been involved after the fact.
King had previously been arrested in another kidnapping case, though charges were dropped due to lack of appearance by victims and witnesses.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who went missing in Philadelphia and whose remains were found behind an abandoned school.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her disappearance and subsequent discovery are central to the investigation and public concern about missing persons and violence in the community.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with multiple crimes related to Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect linked to the case through cell phone data, video evidence, and the stolen vehicle used in the events surrounding Scott’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The lead prosecutor in the case, responsible for filing charges and stating the legal direction of the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly confirmed the possibility of homicide charges and emphasized adherence to legal procedures, shaping public and judicial understanding of the case.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided details about the investigation, including the anonymous tip and video evidence.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided key investigative updates, such as the role of the tip that led to the discovery of the remains and the evidence linking King to Scott’s case.

namedEntities.name: Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle linked to Keon King and the timeline of Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was seen on video on the day Scott disappeared and later found on fire, forming a key piece of evidence in the case.

namedEntities.name: abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location where Kada Scott’s remains were found behind a wooded area.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as a critical geographic and investigative site tied to the discovery of the body and the broader case context.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The hometown of Keon King, where he resides.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for King’s background and potential jurisdictional implications in the investigation.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city where Kada Scott went missing and where the remains were discovered.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the central location of the crime and the jurisdiction where the authorities are operating.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing in Philadelphia, were discovered behind an abandoned school after an anonymous tip led investigators to return to the site. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence including King’s cellphone movements, video footage of a stolen Hyundai Accent seen on the night of her disappearance, and the vehicle’s subsequent fire support the investigation. Prosecutors say more charges may follow, and others may have been involved. The case has drawn attention due to the tragic nature of Scott’s death and the mounting legal and evidentiary connections to King.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
